Authors: Michael Alexander Gerschwitz-Eidt, Joachim W. Kadereit
Title:
Species composition of Saxifraga sect. Saxifraga subsect.
Arachnoideae (Saxifragaceae) based on DNA sequence evidence
Keywords:
ecology, homoplasy, ITS, morphological characters,
rpl32-trnL, trnL-F
Abstract:
We investigated the species composition of Saxifraga sect.
Saxifraga subsect. Arachnoideae, a recently recognized taxon, using DNA
sequence data (ITS, trnL-F, rpl32-trnL). We conclude that the subsection
contains 12 species, i.e., S. aphylla, S. arachnoidea, S. berica, S.
facchinii, S. hohenwartii, S. muscoides, S. paradoxa, S. petraea, S.
prenja, S. presolanensis, S. sedoides and S. tenella. Of these, S.
muscoides and S. prenja had not been recognized to belong to subsect.
Arachnoideae before. We conclude that it is not possible to characterize
the subsection and to distinguish it from subsect. Saxifraga using
morphological characters. A key to the species of the S. sedoides-group
(S. hohenwartii, S. prenja, S. sedoides) is provided.
